summary: Romance languages, like Spanish, French, and Italian, come from an old form of Latin. They are spoken by over 900 million people worldwide, especially in Europe, the Americas, and Africa, due to European colonization. These languages are related and form a group within the larger Indo-European language family. In Europe, they are often compared to Germanic languages. Many people learn them as second languages, making them useful for communication across different regions.
title: Romance languages
